title: Map Identity
description:
Prove that mapping the identity function over a list returns the same list.

**Goal:** `forall (A : Type) (l : list A), map (fun x => x) l = l`

The `map` function applies a function to every element of a list. When that function is the identity, the list is unchanged.
hints: The base case: `map id [] = []` simplifies directly
For the inductive case, `simpl` reduces `map (fun x => x) (a :: l')` to `a :: map (fun x => x) l'`
Use the inductive hypothesis to rewrite `map (fun x => x) l'` to `l'`
template:
Theorem map_id : forall (A : Type) (l : list A),
  map (fun x => x) l = l.
Proof.
  (* Your proof here *)
Admitted.
solution:
Theorem map_id : forall (A : Type) (l : list A),
  map (fun x => x) l = l.
Proof.
  intros A l.
  induction l as [| x l' IHl'].
  - simpl. reflexivity.
  - simpl. rewrite IHl'. reflexivity.
Qed.
